back_cards.definition_en: The fifth day of the week, following Thursday.
back_cards.example_en: I have a meeting every Friday afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: A day often associated with the end of the workweek.
back_cards.example_en: On Friday, we usually go out for drinks after work.

back_cards.definition_en: A day for religious observance in some cultures.
back_cards.example_en: Friday prayers are important for many in the community.

back_cards.definition_en: A casual term for a relaxed day before the weekend.
back_cards.example_en: I’m looking forward to a chill Friday at home.

back_cards.definition_en: A day often used for scheduling events or deadlines.
back_cards.example_en: The project is due by close of business on Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional who represents clients in legal matters.
back_cards.example_en: The attorney prepared a strong case for the trial.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who provides legal advice.
back_cards.example_en: She consulted an attorney about her contract dispute.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a lawyer in formal settings.
back_cards.example_en: The attorney addressed the judge during the hearing.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who acts on behalf of another in legal proceedings.
back_cards.example_en: He hired an attorney to handle his divorce.

back_cards.definition_en: A specialist in a specific area of law.
back_cards.example_en: The tax attorney helped us navigate complex regulations.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to introduce a condition that must be met.
back_cards.example_en: You can’t go to the party unless you finish your homework.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates an exception to a statement.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll be there on time unless traffic is bad.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express a prerequisite in daily decisions.
back_cards.example_en: We won’t go hiking unless the weather clears up.

back_cards.definition_en: A term to set boundaries in agreements.
back_cards.example_en: The deal is off unless both sides agree.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to clarify conditional outcomes in discussions.
back_cards.example_en: Unless you call ahead, the restaurant might be full.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to introduce a further negative statement.
back_cards.example_en: She didn’t call, nor did she text.

back_cards.definition_en: Combines two negative ideas in formal speech.
back_cards.example_en: He has no experience, nor does he have the qualifications.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in writing to emphasize negation.
back_cards.example_en: The plan was neither practical nor affordable.

back_cards.definition_en: Links negative clauses in logical arguments.
back_cards.example_en: I don’t like coffee, nor do I drink tea.

back_cards.definition_en: Appears in formal or legal contexts to deny multiple things.
back_cards.example_en: The contract allows neither refunds nor exchanges.

back_cards.definition_en: A person with specialized knowledge or skill.
back_cards.example_en: The expert gave a talk on climate change solutions.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone recognized for proficiency in a field.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an expert in cybersecurity.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional consulted for advice.
back_cards.example_en: We hired an expert to review our financial plan.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who excels in a specific activity.
back_cards.example_en: He’s an expert at fixing vintage cars.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who provides authoritative opinions.
back_cards.example_en: The expert testified in court about the evidence.

back_cards.definition_en: The arrangement or framework of something.
back_cards.example_en: The building’s structure was designed to withstand earthquakes.

back_cards.definition_en: A system or organization of parts.
back_cards.example_en: The company reorganized its management structure.

back_cards.definition_en: A physical construction or formation.
back_cards.example_en: The bridge’s structure is a marvel of engineering.

back_cards.definition_en: The way something is built or composed.
back_cards.example_en: The novel’s structure alternates between two timelines.

back_cards.definition_en: A framework for processes or ideas.
back_cards.example_en: The course has a clear structure for learning grammar.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan for managing income and expenses.
back_cards.example_en: We created a budget to save for a vacation.

back_cards.definition_en: The amount of money allocated for a purpose.
back_cards.example_en: The project stayed within its budget.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial limit set for personal spending.
back_cards.example_en: I’m on a tight budget this month.

back_cards.definition_en: A government’s financial plan for public spending.
back_cards.example_en: The city’s budget includes funds for new parks.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for tracking business expenses.
back_cards.example_en: The department’s budget was approved by the board.

back_cards.definition_en: A contract to protect against financial loss.
back_cards.example_en: I bought car insurance to cover accidents.

back_cards.definition_en: A system to manage risks or damages.
back_cards.example_en: Health insurance paid for her hospital stay.

back_cards.definition_en: A policy for personal or property protection.
back_cards.example_en: Homeowners insurance covers storm damage.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial product for unexpected events.
back_cards.example_en: Travel insurance is useful for international trips.

back_cards.definition_en: A business tool to mitigate liabilities.
back_cards.example_en: The company offers insurance for its employees.

back_cards.definition_en: Written or printed words.
back_cards.example_en: The book’s text was easy to read.

back_cards.definition_en: A message sent via phone or digital device.
back_cards.example_en: She sent a quick text to confirm the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: The main body of content in a document.
back_cards.example_en: The text of the article was well-researched.

back_cards.definition_en: A source material for study or analysis.
back_cards.example_en: This text is required for the literature course.

back_cards.definition_en: A digital communication in informal settings.
back_cards.example_en: I got a text from my friend about the party.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being free from restrictions.
back_cards.example_en: Freedom of speech is a core democratic value.

back_cards.definition_en: Personal liberty to make choices.
back_cards.example_en: She values the freedom to travel anywhere.

back_cards.definition_en: The absence of oppression or control.
back_cards.example_en: The movement fought for freedom from injustice.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to act without constraint.
back_cards.example_en: Retirement gave him the freedom to pursue hobbies.

back_cards.definition_en: A concept in philosophical or political discussions.
back_cards.example_en: The debate focused on balancing security and freedom.

back_cards.definition_en: Wild or unpredictable in behavior.
back_cards.example_en: The party was crazy with loud music and dancing.

back_cards.definition_en: Extremely enthusiastic or excited.
back_cards.example_en: She’s crazy about her new puppy.

back_cards.definition_en: Unusual or surprising in a situation.
back_cards.example_en: It’s crazy how fast the year went by.

back_cards.definition_en: Informal term for irrational or strange.
back_cards.example_en: His crazy ideas always spark debate.

back_cards.definition_en: Intense or extreme in degree.
back_cards.example_en: The storm caused crazy amounts of rain.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who reads books or texts.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an avid reader of mystery novels.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who interprets or reviews written material.
back_cards.example_en: The editor asked a reader to check the manuscript.

back_cards.definition_en: A device or tool for reading data.
back_cards.example_en: The e-reader displays books in digital format.

back_cards.definition_en: A person engaged in reading for study.
back_cards.example_en: The reader highlighted key points in the textbook.

back_cards.definition_en: An audience member for written content.
back_cards.example_en: The blog post attracted thousands of readers.

back_cards.definition_en: A distinctive manner of expression or appearance.
back_cards.example_en: Her writing style is clear and engaging.

back_cards.definition_en: A fashion or trend in clothing or design.
back_cards.example_en: His style includes bold colors and patterns.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of doing something unique to a person.
back_cards.example_en: The chef’s cooking style is innovative.

back_cards.definition_en: A category of artistic or creative work.
back_cards.example_en: The painting reflects a modernist style.

back_cards.definition_en: A manner of behavior or presentation.
back_cards.example_en: She handled the meeting with confidence and style.

back_cards: definition moving from one side to another.
back_cards.example_en: We walked through the park to get home.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating completion of a process.
back_cards.example_en: She read through the entire report.

back_cards.definition_en: By means of or using something.
back_cards.example_en: I learned about the event through a friend.

back_cards.definition_en: During a period of time.
back_cards.example_en: The shop is open through the weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating passage within a space.
back_cards.example_en: The river flows through the valley.

back_cards.definition_en: The third month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: My birthday is in March.

back_cards.definition_en: A month associated with spring in some regions.
back_cards.example_en: March brings warmer weather to the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for seasonal events or holidays.
back_cards.example_en: The festival is held every March.

back_cards.definition_en: A period often linked to academic or fiscal cycles.
back_cards.example_en: The budget is finalized in March.

back_cards.definition_en: A month for historical or cultural observances.
back_cards.example_en: March is Women’s History Month in the U.S.

back_cards.definition_en: A device that performs a specific task.
back_cards.example_en: The washing machine broke down yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: A complex system or apparatus.
back_cards.example_en: The factory uses a machine to assemble cars.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool powered by electricity or mechanics.
back_cards.example_en: This machine scans documents quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphorical term for an efficient organization.
back_cards.example_en: The team worked like a well-oiled machine.

back_cards.definition_en: A device used in scientific or industrial settings.
back_cards.example_en: The lab’s machine analyzes chemical samples.

back_cards.definition_en: The eleventh month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: We’re planning a trip in November.

back_cards.definition_en: A month associated with fall in the Northern Hemisphere.
back_cards.example_en: November leaves create a colorful landscape.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for holidays like Thanksgiving in the U.S.
back_cards.example_en: November is busy with family gatherings.

back_cards.definition_en: A period for elections or civic events.
back_cards.example_en: The vote takes place in early November.

back_cards.definition_en: A month for seasonal or cultural festivals.
back_cards.example_en: November hosts the city’s annual film festival.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people born around the same time.
back_cards.example_en: My generation grew up with smartphones.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of producing or creating something.
back_cards.example_en: The generation of new ideas is vital for progress.

back_cards.definition_en: A stage in a family or lineage.
back_cards.example_en: This recipe has been passed down for generations.

back_cards.definition_en: A cohort sharing cultural or social traits.
back_cards.example_en: The younger generation values sustainability.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of producing energy or resources.
back_cards.example_en: Solar panels aid in clean energy generation.

back_cards.definition_en: Money earned from work or investments.
back_cards.example_en: Her income comes from freelancing.

back_cards.definition_en: Financial resources for personal expenses.
back_cards.example_en: He budgets his income carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: Revenue generated by a business.
back_cards.example_en: The company’s income increased this year.

back_cards.definition_en: Funds received from various sources.
back_cards.example_en: Rental income helps pay the mortgage.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure of economic status.
back_cards.example_en: Low income qualifies her for assistance.

back_cards.definition_en: Brought into existence by birth.
back_cards.example_en: She was born in a small town.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a specific innate quality or talent.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a born leader on the team.

back_cards.definition_en: Originating from a particular time or place.
back_cards.example_en: The idea was born during a brainstorming session.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe the start of something.
back_cards.example_en: A new movement was born in the community.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating a natural inclination.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a born artist with incredible sketches.

back_cards.definition_en: To confess or acknowledge something.
back_cards.example_en: He had to admit he made a mistake.

back_cards.definition_en: To allow entry to a place or event.
back_cards.example_en: The ticket admits two people to the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: To accept someone into a program or institution.
back_cards.example_en: She was admitted to the university.

back_cards.definition_en: To concede a point in an argument.
back_cards.example_en: I admit your plan sounds better.

back_cards.definition_en: To reveal a truth reluctantly.
back_cards.example_en: He admitted feeling nervous about the speech.

back_cards.definition_en: A greeting used to address someone.
back_cards.example_en: She waved and said hello to her neighbor.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to start a conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Hello, can you help me find this book?

back_cards.definition_en: Used to answer a phone call.
back_cards.example_en: He picked up the phone and said, ‘Hello?’

back_cards.definition_en: A friendly expression in casual settings.
back_cards.example_en: Hello! It’s great to see you again.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to get someone’s attention.
back_cards.example_en: Hello, excuse me, you dropped your keys.

back_cards.definition_en: Moving to a position on the surface of something.
back_cards.example_en: The cat jumped onto the table.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating awareness or discovery.
back_cards.example_en: She’s onto a great business idea.

back_cards.definition_en: Transitioning to a new topic or task.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s move onto the next agenda item.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating physical attachment or contact.
back_cards.example_en: He held onto the railing for support.

back_cards.definition_en: Directing attention toward something.
back_cards.example_en: The spotlight shifted onto the main speaker.

back_cards.definition_en: A large body of saltwater.
back_cards.example_en: The sea was calm during our boat trip.

back_cards.definition_en: A vast expanse or area.
back_cards.example_en: A sea of flowers covered the field.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting for marine activities.
back_cards.example_en: The sailors navigated the rough sea.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphorical term for overwhelming quantity.
back_cards.example_en: She faced a sea of paperwork at work.

back_cards.definition_en: A region for exploration or travel.
back_cards.example_en: The cruise explored the Mediterranean Sea.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of agreement or approval.
back_cards.example_en: Okay, let’s start the meeting now.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to confirm understanding.
back_cards.example_en: Okay, I see what you mean.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to reassure or calm someone.
back_cards.example_en: It’s okay, we’ll figure it out.

back_cards.definition_en: A casual acknowledgment in conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Okay, I’ll call you later.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating something is satisfactory.
back_cards.example_en: The food was okay, but not amazing.

back_cards.definition_en: The opening in the face used for eating and speaking.
back_cards.example_en: She covered her mouth while laughing.

back_cards.definition_en: The entrance or exit of a place.
back_cards.example_en: The river flows into the mouth of the bay.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for speech or expression.
back_cards.example_en: Word of mouth spread the news quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: A body part for tasting or kissing.
back_cards.example_en: The candy melted in her mouth.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphorical reference to boldness.
back_cards.example_en: He has a big mouth and always speaks up.

back_cards.definition_en: In every part of a place or thing.
back_cards.example_en: The festival is celebrated throughout the country.

back_cards.definition_en: During the entire time of an event.
back_cards.example_en: She worked throughout the night to finish.

back_cards.definition_en: Across all areas or aspects.
back_cards.example_en: The policy applies throughout the organization.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating widespread presence.
back_cards.example_en: Flowers bloomed throughout the garden.

back_cards.definition_en: In every stage of a process.
back_cards.example_en: He stayed focused throughout the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Belonging to oneself or itself.
back_cards.example_en: She built her own business from scratch.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating personal possession.
back_cards.example_en: He has his own car now.

back_cards.definition_en: Done independently without help.
back_cards.example_en: I completed the project on my own.

back_cards.definition_en: Emphasizing individual responsibility.
back_cards.example_en: You need to make your own decisions.

back_cards.definition_en: Unique to a person or thing.
back_cards.example_en: The artist has her own style of painting.

back_cards.definition_en: An examination to assess knowledge or ability.
back_cards.example_en: She studied all night for the math test.

back_cards.definition_en: A procedure to evaluate performance or quality.
back_cards.example_en: The car passed the safety test.

back_cards.definition_en: A trial to measure something’s effectiveness.
back_cards.example_en: The lab conducted a test on the new drug.

back_cards.definition_en: A challenge to prove capability.
back_cards.example_en: The hike was a test of their endurance.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to verify functionality.
back_cards.example_en: The software test revealed several bugs.

back_cards.definition_en: A network of interconnected digital content.
back_cards.example_en: The web makes information accessible worldwide.

back_cards.definition_en: A spider’s woven structure for catching prey.
back_cards.example_en: A spider spun a web in the corner.

back_cards.definition_en: A complex system of connections.
back_cards.example_en: The scandal uncovered a web of corruption.

back_cards.definition_en: Short for the World Wide Web.
back_cards.example_en: I found the recipe on the web.

back_cards.definition_en: A network of relationships or interactions.
back_cards.example_en: She’s caught in a web of family obligations.

back_cards.definition_en: To move something back and forth quickly.
back_cards.example_en: Shake the bottle before opening it.

back_cards.definition_en: To tremble or vibrate from emotion or force.
back_cards.example_en: Her hands shook from nervousness.

back_cards.definition_en: To disrupt or unsettle someone.
back_cards.example_en: The news shook the entire community.

back_cards.definition_en: To mix ingredients by vigorous motion.
back_cards.example_en: He shook the cocktail with ice.

back_cards.definition_en: To get rid of or dislodge something.
back_cards.example_en: She shook the dust off her jacket.

back_cards.definition_en: A statement of intent to cause harm.
back_cards.example_en: The email contained a serious threat.

back_cards.definition_en: A potential danger or risk.
back_cards.example_en: Climate change is a threat to wildlife.

back_cards.definition_en: An indication of impending trouble.
back_cards.example_en: Dark clouds were a threat of rain.

back_cards.definition_en: A challenge to safety or security.
back_cards.example_en: The new virus poses a health threat.

back_cards.definition_en: A warning in a conflict or dispute.
back_cards.example_en: The company ignored the union’s threat to strike.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to solve a problem or issue.
back_cards.example_en: The team found a solution to the budget issue.

back_cards.definition_en: An answer to a puzzle or question.
back_cards.example_en: She figured out the solution to the riddle.

back_cards.definition_en: A liquid mixture in scientific contexts.
back_cards.example_en: The lab prepared a chemical solution.

back_cards.definition_en: A resolution to a conflict.
back_cards.example_en: Diplomacy was the solution to the dispute.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to achieve a goal.
back_cards.example_en: Recycling is a solution for reducing waste.

back_cards.definition_en: To close something like a door or window.
back_cards.example_en: Please shut the door behind you.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop an operation or activity.
back_cards.example_en: The factory shut down for maintenance.

back_cards.definition_en: To block access or communication.
back_cards.example_en: He shut off his phone during the movie.

back_cards.definition_en: To close a business permanently.
back_cards.example_en: The store shut after years of losses.

back_cards.definition_en: To silence or stop someone from speaking.
back_cards.example_en: She shut him up with a quick reply.

back_cards.definition_en: Toward a lower position or level.
back_cards.example_en: She walked down the stairs carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating a decrease or reduction.
back_cards.example_en: The prices went down during the sale.

back_cards.definition_en: To a state of being off or not working.
back_cards.example_en: The system is down for repairs.

back_cards.definition_en: In a direction toward the ground.
back_cards.example_en: The rain came down heavily.

back_cards.definition_en: To a less active or intense state.
back_cards.example_en: He calmed down after the argument.

back_cards.definition_en: To go from one place to another.
back_cards.example_en: They plan to travel across Europe next summer.

back_cards.definition_en: To move or journey for leisure or work.
back_cards.example_en: She travels for her job every month.

back_cards.definition_en: To explore new places or cultures.
back_cards.example_en: He loves to travel and try local foods.

back_cards.definition_en: To move quickly, as in news or information.
back_cards.example_en: The rumor traveled fast through the town.

back_cards.definition_en: To commute or go regularly.
back_cards.example_en: I travel to the city for work daily.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who conducts scientific research.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist discovered a new species.

back_cards.definition_en: An expert in a field of science.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a scientist studying marine biology.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who uses experiments to gain knowledge.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist tested the hypothesis carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional in a lab or academic setting.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist published a paper on genetics.

back_cards.definition_en: A contributor to technological advancements.
back_cards.example_en: Scientists developed a new solar panel.

back_cards.definition_en: To conceal oneself from view.
back_cards.example_en: The kids hid behind the couch during the game.

back_cards.definition_en: To cover or keep something out of sight.
back_cards.example_en: She hid the gift under her bed.

back_cards.definition_en: To keep information secret.
back_cards.example_en: He tried to hide his feelings from her.

back_cards.definition_en: To take shelter or avoid detection.
back_cards.example_en: The animal hid from predators in the bushes.

back_cards.definition_en: To obscure or disguise something.
back_cards.example_en: The fog hid the mountain from view.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that is clear or easily understood.
back_cards.example_en: She was obviously upset about the news.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize an evident fact.
back_cards.example_en: It’s obviously going to rain this afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: In a manner that is unmistakable.
back_cards.example_en: He was obviously the best candidate.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in conversation to state the obvious.
back_cards.example_en: Obviously, we need more time to prepare.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating something apparent to all.
back_cards.example_en: The solution was obviously the simplest one.

back_cards.definition_en: To mention or direct attention to something.
back_cards.example_en: She referred to the book during her speech.

back_cards.definition_en: To send someone to a source for help.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor referred him to a specialist.

back_cards.definition_en: To cite as a source of information.
back_cards.example_en: The article refers to recent studies.

back_cards.definition_en: To assign or attribute something.
back_cards.example_en: They refer to the project as a game-changer.

back_cards.definition_en: To consult or look up information.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll refer to the manual for instructions.

back_cards.definition_en: Being by oneself without others.
back_cards.example_en: She prefers to work alone in the office.

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling isolated or without company.
back_cards.example_en: He felt alone in the crowded room.

back_cards.definition_en: Exclusively or solely.
back_cards.example_en: The decision was hers alone to make.

back_cards.definition_en: Without assistance or support.
back_cards.example_en: I can handle this task alone.

back_cards.definition_en: Unique or unmatched in some way.
back_cards.example_en: This restaurant is alone in its quality.

back_cards.definition_en: To consume a liquid through the mouth.
back_cards.example_en: She drank a glass of water after the run.

back_cards.definition_en: To take in alcohol socially.
back_cards.example_en: They drank wine at the dinner party.

back_cards.definition_en: To absorb or take in something metaphorically.
back_cards.example_en: He drank in the beauty of the sunset.

back_cards.definition_en: To enjoy a beverage in a specific context.
back_cards.example_en: We drank coffee while discussing plans.

back_cards.definition_en: To toast or celebrate with a beverage.
back_cards.example_en: They drank to the couple’s happiness.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal inquiry to uncover facts.
back_cards.example_en: The police launched an investigation into the theft.

back_cards.definition_en: A detailed examination of a situation.
back_cards.example_en: The investigation revealed new evidence.

back_cards.definition_en: A process to study a scientific question.
back_cards.example_en: Her investigation focused on climate patterns.

back_cards.definition_en: A probe into misconduct or errors.
back_cards.example_en: The company faced an investigation for fraud.

back_cards.definition_en: A search for truth or information.
back_cards.example_en: The journalist’s investigation exposed corruption.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a legislative senate.
back_cards.example_en: The senator proposed a new education bill.

back_cards.definition_en: A political figure in a governing body.
back_cards.example_en: She met with the senator to discuss policy.

back_cards.definition_en: A representative in a national or state senate.
back_cards.example_en: The senator campaigned for re-election.

back_cards.definition_en: A leader in legislative decision-making.
back_cards.example_en: The senator voted against the proposal.

back_cards.definition_en: A public figure in political debates.
back_cards.example_en: The senator spoke at the town hall meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: A single item or component.
back_cards.example_en: The apartment complex has 50 units.

back_cards.definition_en: A group functioning as a single entity.
back_cards.example_en: The military unit trained for months.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure or standard of quantity.
back_cards.example_en: The recipe calls for one unit of sugar.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a larger system or machine.
back_cards.example_en: The air conditioning unit stopped working.

back_cards.definition_en: A section of a course or curriculum.

back_cards.example_en: The community shares a common faith.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a skilled occupation.
back_cards.example_en: She maintains a professional attitude at work.

back_cards.definition_en: Done with high skill or competence.
back_cards.example_en: The report was written in a professional style.

back_cards.definition_en: Engaged in a career or profession.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a professional chef with years of experience.

back_cards.definition_en: Conforming to workplace standards.
back_cards.example_en: Her professional conduct impressed the team.

back_cards.definition_en: Paid for work, not amateur.
back_cards.example_en: The team hired a professional designer.

back_cards.definition_en: To show an image, as in a mirror.
back_cards.example_en: The lake reflected the mountains beautifully.

back_cards.definition_en: To think deeply or carefully.
back_cards.example_en: She reflected on her career choices.

back_cards.definition_en: To represent or show something.
back_cards.example_en: His actions reflect his kind nature.

back_cards.definition_en: To bounce back light or sound.
back_cards.example_en: The walls reflect the sound clearly.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate or express a quality.
back_cards.example_en: Her work reflects great creativity.

back_cards.definition_en: People in general, especially from a community.
back_cards.example_en: The folk in the village are friendly.

back_cards.definition_en: A group with shared culture or traditions.
back_cards.example_en: The festival celebrates local folk.

back_cards.definition_en: Informal term for family or relatives.
back_cards.example_en: I’m visiting my folk this weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: Traditional or common people.
back_cards.example_en: Folk tales were passed down for generations.

back_cards.definition_en: A collective group in a story.
back_cards.example_en: The folk gathered to hear the news.

back_cards.definition_en: The outer or top layer of something.
back_cards.example_en: The table’s surface was scratched.

back_cards.definition_en: The exterior of an object or area.
back_cards.example_en: The moon’s surface is covered in craters.

back_cards.definition_en: A flat area for work or activity.
back_cards.example_en: She cleared the surface for cooking.

back_cards.definition_en: The visible part of something deeper.
back_cards.example_en: His smile hid the pain beneath the surface.

back_cards.definition_en: A boundary between two substances.
back_cards.example_en: Oil floated on the water’s surface.

back_cards.definition_en: To drop or descend to the ground.
back_cards.example_en: The leaves fall every autumn.

back_cards.definition_en: To decrease in amount or value.
back_cards.example_en: The temperature will fall tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: To stumble or lose balance.
back_cards.example_en: He fell while climbing the stairs.

back_cards.definition_en: To happen or occur, as an event.
back_cards.example_en: The holiday falls on a Monday.

back_cards.definition_en: To enter a particular state.
back_cards.example_en: She fell silent after the news.

back_cards.definition_en: A person using professional services.
back_cards.example_en: The lawyer met with her client.

back_cards.definition_en: A customer of a business.
back_cards.example_en: The store values every client.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone receiving ongoing support.
back_cards.example_en: The therapist helped her client cope.

back_cards.definition_en: A user of a company’s products.
back_cards.example_en: The software was designed for clients.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a business relationship.
back_cards.example_en: He secured a new client for the firm.

back_cards.definition_en: The outer boundary of an object.
back_cards.example_en: The glass was placed on the table’s edge.

back_cards.definition_en: A point of transition or limit.
back_cards.example_en: She’s on the edge of a breakthrough.

back_cards.definition_en: A sharp or cutting part.
back_cards.example_en: The knife’s edge was razor-sharp.

back_cards.definition_en: An advantage over others.
back_cards.example_en: Her experience gave her an edge.

back_cards.definition_en: A tense or nervous state.
back_cards.example_en: The news put everyone on edge.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to long-established customs.
back_cards.example_en: The wedding followed traditional rituals.

back_cards.definition_en: Passed down through generations.
back_cards.example_en: She cooked a traditional family recipe.

back_cards.definition_en: Conventional or standard in approach.
back_cards.example_en: He prefers traditional teaching methods.

back_cards.definition_en: Reflecting cultural or historical norms.
back_cards.example_en: The festival celebrates traditional music.

back_cards.definition_en: Not modern or experimental.
back_cards.example_en: The house has a traditional design.

back_cards.definition_en: A group formed to make decisions.
back_cards.example_en: The city council approved the new park.

back_cards.definition_en: An advisory or governing body.
back_cards.example_en: The council met to discuss policies.

back_cards.definition_en: A group managing local affairs.
back_cards.example_en: She was elected to the town council.

back_cards.definition_en: An organization for specific purposes.
back_cards.example_en: The student council planned the event.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal assembly for discussion.
back_cards.example_en: The council debated the budget cuts.
